Attributes.title: Calculation Round Up
Attributes.description: Specify round up of device calculation for nearest amount value.
Attributes.Definition: Result of (Device Cost âˆ’ Device Subsidy) / Contract Period can be rounded up to a decimal or whole number. For example, if 0 is specified, result will not be rounded (e.g. 12.23 --> 12.23). If 0.5 is specified, result will be rounded up to nearest 0.5 (e.g. 12.23 --> 12.50). If 2 is specified, result will be rounded up to nearest even number (e.g. 13.12 --> 14.00), and so on.

Attributes.title: Change Base Plan
Attributes.description: Specify what happens to device contract when the base plan flavor is changed.
Attributes.Definition: Specify the rule that should be applied when the base plan is upgraded or downgraded.
enum: Change Device Flavor to Match Base Plan

Attributes.title: Device SICs
Attributes.description: Specify list of Device SICs separated by semicolon.
Attributes.Definition: List of Device SICs is needed to configure the devices on the system.

Attributes.title: Device Source Cost
Attributes.description: Specify initial device cost that will be used as base for calculations.
Attributes.Definition: The original device cost (which doesn't include profit margin) or the retail cost (which includes profit margin) can be used as the base of the initial device cost.

Attributes.title: Device Subsidy
Attributes.description: Specify subsidy amount for the devices.
Attributes.Definition: A device can be subsidized to reduce its cost so that it can attract customers to buy it. Usually, a subsidized device is provided as installments and bundled with other services.

Attributes.title: Device Type
Attributes.description: Specify type of the device.
Attributes.Definition: Type of device denotes whether specific devices should be restricted for provisioning.

Attributes.title: GL Code
Attributes.description: Specify Finance GL code for this charge.
Attributes.Definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

Attributes.title: Max Allowed Cost
Attributes.description: Specify maximum device cost that can be sold to the customer.
Attributes.Definition: The maximum device cost which can be provided to the customer can be restricted so that only devices below or equal the maxim allowed cost can be provided. This can be used to assure revenues as higher device costs can be riskier to recover its cost via indirect revenues.

Attributes.title: Notes
Attributes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Device can be added here.

Attributes.title: Overflow After Subsidy
Attributes.description: Specify how to handle if the subsidy amount doesn't cover the device cost.
Attributes.Definition: In case the subsidy amount on the device doesn't cover its cost completely, then this can be handled in three different ways: spread this extra charge as periodic installments, post the extra charge as a one-time charge, or prevent the customer from taking the device when the subsidy cannot cover its cost.

Attributes.title: Required Device Tags
Attributes.description: Specify required tags on the device so it becomes applicable. (Empty means any tag)
Attributes.Definition: Certain tags on the device can be used to restrict the allowed devices.

Attributes.title: Feedback Channels
Attributes.description: Specify channel of communication where the user will get the inquiry feedback.
Attributes.Definition: Inquiry feedback message can be send to the customer as USSD, SMS, or Email.

Attributes.title: Feedback Text
Attributes.description: Specify message content that user will receive in reply to the inquiry request.
Attributes.Default: "Dear Etisalat customer, you have consumed all your freebees. To get more, contact Etisalat."
Attributes.Definition: Feedback text can contain any characters but it should within characters limit if the channel is USSD or SMS. If special information should be included, then they should be included in curly braces such as {Remaining Call Freebees Amount} or {Expiry Date}.

Attributes.title: Inquiry Channel
Attributes.description: Specify channel of communication that the user should use to inquire.
Attributes.Definition: Customer can initiate the inquiry by sending a text to USSD, SMS, or Email.

Attributes.title: Inquiry Command
Attributes.description: Specify command and destination that the user should send to get inquiry.
Attributes.Definition: Inquiry command should state the text that the customer should send for the inquiry and the destination which should process the inquiry request.

Attributes.title: Notes
Attributes.description: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Inquiry property can be added here.

Attributes.title: Sender Identifier
Attributes.description: Specify SMS short code or Email address that will send the message reply of the inquiry.
Attributes.Definition: In case the "Inquiry Channel" is SMS, the short code of the sender is required. In case the "Inquiry Channel" is Email, the email address of the sender is required.

Attributes.title: Service Type
Attributes.description: Specify services (Call/Message/Data) for which the usage should be inquired.
Attributes.Definition: A single inquiry feedback message can contain information about the freebees consumption or tariff usage of Call, Message, or Data.

Attributes.title: Event Value
Attributes.description: Specify numeric value for notification event.
Attributes.Definition: For certain Notification Events, another value need to be specified.

Attributes.title: Notes
Attributes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Notification can be added here.

Attributes.title: Notification Channel
Attributes.description: Specify channel of communication that the user will get the notification.
Attributes.Definition: Notification message can be send to the customer as USSD, SMS, or Email.

Attributes.title: Notification Event
Attributes.description: Specify what triggers the notification.
Attributes.Definition: Notification Event specifies the condition that triggers the sending of the message to the customer.

Freebees 80% Reached, Freebees 90% Reached, Freebees 100% Reached

Attributes.Default: "Dear Etisalat customer, your freebees consumption is started."
Attributes.Definition: Notification text can contain any characters but it should within characters limit if the channel is USSD or SMS. If special information should be included, then they should be included in curly braces such as {Remaining Call Freebees Amount} or {Expiry Date}.

Attributes.title: Sender Identifier
Attributes.description: Specify SMS short code or Email address that will send the notification.
Attributes.Definition: In case the "Notification Channel" is SMS, the short code of the sender is required. In case the "Notification Channel" is Email, the email address of the sender is required.

Attributes.title: Service Type
Attributes.description: Specify services (Call/Message/Data) for which the usage notification should be sent.
Attributes.Definition: A single notification message can contain information about the freebees consumption or tariff usage of Call, Message, or Data.

Attributes.Definition: Unused freebees can be transfer to the new MSISDN or removed.

Attributes.description: Specify whether ownership transfer is allowed or not.
Attributes.Definition: Ownership transfer (AKA subscribership transfer) determines whether the owner of an account (MSISDN) can be changed or not.

Attributes.description: Specify whether the contract can be transferred to the new owner or not.
Attributes.Definition: Contract on the original owner may or may not be transferred to the new owner.

Attributes.Definition: Existing unsettled amount due need to be handled properly when for the ownership transfer to occur correctly.

Attributes.Definition: Office Phone

Attributes.title: Position

Attributes.Definition: Role In Project

Attributes.title: Product Developer
Attributes.description: Specify name of the SPOC from Product Development for this project.
Attributes.Definition: Product Developer ensures business rules are complete and captured correctly.

Attributes.title: Product Owner
Attributes.description: Specify name of the SPOC from Product Marketing for this project.
Attributes.Definition: Product Owner defines the business rules regarding the product.

Attributes.title: Completion Date
Attributes.description: Specify target completion date of the project.
Attributes.Definition: The expected or agreed completion date of the project.

Attributes.title: Notes
Attributes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Project can be added here.

Attributes.title: Project ID
Attributes.description: Specify ID of the project.
Attributes.Definition: Project ID is tracked in Portfolio and Project Management (PPM) tool.

Attributes.title: Project Name
Attributes.description: Specify name of the project.
Attributes.Definition: Name of the project is unique across the organization and it is very concise yet its scope can be easily inferred.

Attributes.title: Project Nature
Attributes.description: Specify nature of the project.
Attributes.Definition: Project nature can be either to create a new product where existing customers will not be impacted or to modify an existing product where existing customers will be impacted.

Attributes.title: Project Summary
Attributes.description: Specify brief description of the project.
Attributes.Definition: Short description of the project that gives high level abstraction about its goals.

Attributes.title: Start Date
Attributes.description: Specify target start date of the project.
Attributes.Definition: The expected or agreed start date of the project.

Attributes.title: Carry-Over Cycles
Attributes.description: Specify grace period that the freebees should continue to exist.
Attributes.Definition: Carry-Over Cycles determines whether to add the unused freebees to the next freebees cycle(s) or remove the unused freebees at the end of the cycle. For example, if a customer has a 100 min monthly freebees and 50 min were consumed only by the end of the month and Carry-Over is allowed, then customer will get 150 min in the next month.

Attributes.title: Destinations Assignment
Attributes.description: Specify how the list of destination numbers can be defined.
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be defined and changed by Etisalat sales or it can be defined and changed by the customer or both. Authorized Etisalat users can use CRM for updating the list. Customer can send SMS message for updating this list.

Attributes.title: Freebees Amount
Attributes.description: Specify amount of freebees to offer.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of call freebees to offer to the customer and it will be treated as free duration period or free charge amount.

Attributes.title: Freebees Cap
Attributes.description: Specify capping rule when all freebees are consumed.
Attributes.Definition: "Freebees Cap" determines whether out-of-bundle charge is allowed after full consumption of freebees amount or not. Most of Freebees allow OOB charge. However, for Data Freebees, the customer can select and change any time whether this should be set to Soft Cap or Hard Cap.

Attributes.title: Freebees Duration
Attributes.description: Specify amount of duration.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees can be specified to last for certain amount of duration type.

Attributes.title: Freebees Duration Type
Attributes.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees can last based on certain duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

Attributes.title: Freebees Priority
Attributes.description: Specify priority with respect to other call freebees.
Attributes.Definition: Priority specifies when the freebees consumption should happen when there are other call freebees exist on the same account.

Attributes.title: Freebees Trigger
Attributes.description: Specify when the freebees start date should begin.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees Start defines when the freebees consumption timer should begin. On Subscription causes the freebees timer to start immediately whether a customer made usages or not. On First Usage will trigger the Freebees timer only when the customer makes any usage. Usually for periodic freebees, this is set to On Subscription. However, for one-time freebees, this selection has a significant difference.

Attributes.title: Freebees Unit
Attributes.description: Specify unit of freebees amount.
Attributes.Definition: Freebees unit specifies what kind of usage that should be considered as freebees. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Charge amount, then usage charges up to this amount will not billed to the customer. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Duration amount, then usage charges up to this period will not billed to the customer.

Attributes.title: Max Destination Changes
Attributes.description: Specify maximum changes allowed per month to the list of destination numbers.
Attributes.Definition: Changes to list of F&F destination numbers can be restricte to certain times per month. When the number of changes per month is reached, the next change cannot happen till next month.

Attributes.title: Max Destinations
Attributes.description: Specify how many numbers allowed in the list of destination numbers.
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be restricted to a limited numbers.

Attributes.title: Nature
Attributes.description: Specify nature of the call.
Attributes.Definition: STD is for national calls. CUG is for calls within same group (Community ID). IDD is for international calls. ICR is for incoming roaming calls. OGR is for outgoing roaming calls. FLEXI is any combination of STD, CUG, IDD, ICR, and OGR.

Attributes.title: Network Lines
Attributes.description: Specify network categories for the call.
Attributes.Definition: Network lines determine whether freebees calls to be restricted of Mobile network only, Fixed network only, or any network. This is useful to be able to make things like freebees to fixed lines only. Note that further restriction can be done by configuring "Direction" attribute.

Attributes.title: Notes
Attributes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional rules or information on Call Freebees can be added here.

Attributes.title: Out-of-Bundle Charge
Attributes.description: Specify out-of-bundle charge of the call.
Attributes.Definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each usage pulse. This will be either AED X per Second or AED X per Minute.

Attributes.title: Out-of-Bundle Pulse
Attributes.description: Specify charging pulse of the call.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.title: Permitted Destinations
Attributes.description: Specify allowed only call destinations.
Attributes.Definition: Target destinations can be restricted to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations outside the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Permitted Sources
Attributes.description: Specify allowed only call sources.
Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be restricted to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators outside the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Prohibited Destinations
Attributes.description: Specify blocked call destinations.
Attributes.Definition: Target destinations can be blocked to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations in the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Prohibited Sources
Attributes.description: Specify blocked call sources.
Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be blocked to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators in the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Prorate on Exit
Attributes.description: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when exit happens.
Attributes.Definition: In most cases, freebees are not prorated on exit which means the unused freebees will continue till end of the cycle.

Attributes.title: Prorate on Subscribe
Attributes.description: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when subscription or upgrade/downgrade happens.
Attributes.Definition: Usually, freebees are prorated when the refill is periodic and the base plan is Postpaid. Note that proration of the charge should match the freebees.

Attributes.title: Refill Cycle
Attributes.description: Specify cycles which the freebees should be refilled.
Attributes.Definition: Refill Cycles determines the behavior of freebees when the Duration is completed. Usually freebees is provided as one-time only or as auto-renew. Monthly auto-renew method behaves differently on Prepaid than on Postpaid. On Prepaid, the start of each cycle is the same day of the month when the first cycle was activated. For Postpaid, the start of each cycle is the first day of the month. That's why prorate happens on first month when the base plan is Postpaid.

Attributes.title: Technology
Attributes.description: Specify technology type of the call.
Attributes.Definition: Call freebees can be configured for Voice calls or Video calls. Note that Voice calls and Video calls are based on "circuit switching" which means the connection line between the caller and the called person is fully occupied by this call and not shared with other calls (unlike "packet switching" which is IP based and allows multiple calls to share the same line). Most of the calls are Voice calls and there are very less calls based on Video. Video calls are not popular because of limited handsets support, no freebees offers on Video calls, and customer awareness.

Attributes.title: Unit Pulse
Attributes.description: Specify charging pulse of the call.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.title: Allow Charge Sponsor
Attributes.description: Specify whether the charge should be billed against master account or individual account.
Attributes.Definition: Usually the individual is responsible of the usage charges. However, the charges can be posted to the family head or the company which the account is linked to it.

Attributes.title: Billing Words
Attributes.description: Specify text that appears in the bill for this charge.
Attributes.Definition: Billing words specify the text that should appear in the invoice which will inform the customer about the type of this usage charges.

Attributes.description: Specify how the list of destination numbers can be defined.
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be defined and changed by Etisalat sales or it can be defined and changed by the customer or both. Authorized Etisalat users can use CRM for updating the list. Customer can send SMS message for updating this list.

If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.title: Permitted Destinations
Attributes.description: Specify allowed only call destinations.
Attributes.Definition: Target destinations can be restricted to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations outside the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Permitted Sources
Attributes.description: Specify allowed only call sources.
Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be restricted to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators outside the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Prohibited Destinations
Attributes.description: Specify blocked call destinations.
Attributes.Definition: Target destinations can be blocked to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations in the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Prohibited Sources
Attributes.description: Specify blocked call sources.
Attributes.Definition: Source initiators can be blocked to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators in the list is not allowed.

Attributes.title: Prorate on Exit
Attributes.description: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when exit happens.
Attributes.Definition: In most cases, freebees are not prorated on exit which means the unused freebees will continue till end of the cycle.

Attributes.title: Prorate on Subscribe
Attributes.description: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when subscription or upgrade/downgrade happens.
Attributes.Definition: Usually, freebees are prorated when the refill is periodic and the base plan is Postpaid. Note that proration of the charge should match the freebees.

Attributes.title: Refill Cycle
Attributes.description: Specify cycles which the freebees should be refilled.
Attributes.Definition: Refill Cycles determines the behavior of freebees when the Duration is completed. Usually freebees is provided as one-time only or as auto-renew. Monthly auto-renew method behaves differently on Prepaid than on Postpaid. On Prepaid, the start of each cycle is the same day of the month when the first cycle was activated. For Postpaid, the start of each cycle is the first day of the month. That's why prorate happens on first month when the base plan is Postpaid.

Attributes.title: Technology
Attributes.description: Specify technology type of the message.
Attributes.Definition: Message freebees can be configured for SMS messages or for MMS messages.

Attributes.title: Unit Pulse
Attributes.description: Specify charging pulse of the message.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.title: Allow Charge Sponsor
Attributes.description: Specify whether the charge should be billed against master account or individual account.
Attributes.Definition: Usually the individual is responsible of the usage charges. However, the charges can be posted to the family head or the company which the account is linked to it.

Attributes.title: Billing Words
Attributes.description: Specify text that appears in the bill for this charge.
Attributes.Definition: Billing words specify the text that should appear in the invoice which will inform the customer about the type of this usage charges.

Attributes.title: Destinations Assignment
Attributes.description: Specify how the list of destination numbers can be defined.
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be defined and changed by Etisalat sales or it can be defined and changed by the customer or both. Authorized Etisalat users can use CRM for updating the list. Customer can send SMS message for updating this list.

Attributes.title: Max Destination Changes
Attributes.description: Specify maximum changes allowed per month to the list of destination numbers.
Attributes.Definition: Changes to list of F&F destination numbers can be restricte to certain times per month. When the number of changes per month is reached, the next change cannot happen till next month.

Attributes.title: Max Destinations
Attributes.description: Specify how many numbers allowed in the list of destination numbers.
Attributes.Definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be restricted to a limited numbers.

Attributes.title: Nature
Attributes.description: Specify nature of the message.
Attributes.Definition: STD is for national messages. CUG is for messages within same group (Community ID). IDD is for international messages. ICR is for incoming roaming messages. OGR is for outgoing roaming messages. FLEXI is any combination of STD, CUG, IDD, ICR, and OGR.

Attributes.title: Notes
Attributes.description: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Message Tariff property can be added here.

Attributes.title: Permitted Sources

Attributes.title: Prohibited Sources

Attributes.title: Tariff Charge
Attributes.description: Specify charge of the message.
Attributes.Definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each usage pulse.

Attributes.title: Technology
Attributes.description: Specify technology type of the message.
Attributes.Definition: Call Tariff can be configured for Voice calls or Video calls. Note that Voice calls and Video calls are based on "circuit switching" which means the connection line between the caller and the called person is fully occupied by this call and not shared with other calls (unlike "packet switching" which is IP based and allows multiple calls to share the same line). Most of the calls are Voice calls and there are very less calls based on Video. Video calls are not popular because of limited handsets support, no freebees offers on Video calls, and customer awareness.

Attributes.title: Unit Pulse
Attributes.description: Specify charging pulse of the message.
Attributes.Definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

Attributes.title: Rewards Amount
Attributes.description: Specify amount of reward points to offer.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of rewards to be given to the customer.

Attributes.title: Rewards Type
Attributes.description: Specify type of rewards to offer.
Attributes.Definition: The type of rewards to be given to the customer.

Attributes.title: Trigger Amount
Attributes.description: Specify trigger amount that causes the rewards to be offered.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of action type that triggers the rewards to be given to the customer.

Attributes.title: Trigger Limit
Attributes.description: Specify trigger limit to restrict number of rewards to be given to the customer.
Attributes.Definition: Trigger can be restricted to certain count instead of indefinitely.

Attributes.title: Trigger Type
Attributes.description: Specify trigger type that causes the rewards to be offered.
Attributes.Definition: The action type that causes the rewards to be offered to the customer.

Attributes.title: Carry-Over Cycles
Attributes.description: Specify grace period that the credit should continue to exist.
Attributes.Definition: Carry-Over Cycles determines whether to add the unused credit to the next credit cycle(s) or remove the unused credit at the end of the cycle. For example, if a customer has a 100 min monthly credit and 50 min were consumed only by the end of the month and Carry-Over is allowed, then customer will get 150 min in the next month.

Attributes.title: Credit Amount
Attributes.description: Specify amount of credit to offer.
Attributes.Definition: The amount of call credit to offer to the customer and it will be treated as free duration period or free charge amount.

Attributes.title: Credit Duration
Attributes.description: Specify amount of duration.
Attributes.Definition: Credit can be specified to last for certain amount of duration type.

Attributes.title: Credit Duration Type
Attributes.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
Attributes.Definition: Credit can last based on certain duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

Attributes.title: Credit Priority
Attributes.description: Specify priority with respect to other credits.
Attributes.Definition: Priority specifies when the credit consumption should happen when there are other call credit exist on the same account.

Attributes.title: Credit Trigger
Attributes.description: Specify when the credit start date should begin.
Attributes.Definition: Credit Start defines when the credit consumption timer should begin. On Subscription causes the credit timer to start immediately whether a customer made usages or not. On First Usage will trigger the Credit timer only when the customer makes any usage. Usually for periodic credit, this is set to On Subscription. However, for one-time credit, this selection has a significant difference.

Attributes.Definition: Usually the individual is responsible of the usage charges. However, the charges can be posted to the family head or the company which the account is linked to it.

Attributes.title: Auto Renew
Attributes.description: Specify whether the contract show automatically renew after completing the contract period.
Attributes.Definition: Contract can be set to automatically renew for the same contract period without customer involvement in which case the exit policy will be applicable again.

Attributes.title: Duration Amount
Attributes.description: Specify amount of duration.
Attributes.Definition: Contract can be specified to lapse for certain amount of duration type.

Attributes.title: Duration Type
Attributes.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
Attributes.Definition: Contract can be specified as a duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

Attributes.title: Exit Policy
Attributes.description: Specify policy when exiting the contract before completing the contract period.
Attributes.Definition: Exit policy can be: No Charge, One Month Charge, Monthly Charge x Remaining Months, One Fixed Charge, or Fixed Charge x Remaining Months.

Attributes.title: Fixed Charge
Attributes.description: Specify amount of fixed charge.
Attributes.Definition: In case "One Fixed Charge" or "Fixed Charge x Remaining Months" is selected, then the fixed charge amount should be specified here.

Attributes.title: Add-on Name
Attributes.description: Specify name of the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Add-on name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service. Add-on name should include flavor name so it is distinctively identifiable.

Attributes.title: Add-on Scope
Attributes.description: Specify scope of the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: From service construction point of view, there are two kinds of add-ons: add-on limited to specific base plans (Add-on) and add-on open to all base plans (Value Added Service).

Attributes.title: Allow Same Type Add-ons
Attributes.description: Specify whether add-ons of same type but different amount are allowed.
Attributes.Definition: Add-ons of same type but different amount can be restricted so that a customer should select one particular add-on within same type because of different price calculations. On the other hand, this restriction can be lifted so that a customer can mix add-ons of different amounts of same type because the charges for each add-on is paid individually.

Attributes.title: Allowed Segments
Attributes.description: Specify segments allowed to subscribe to the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Certain customer categories or segments can be allowed to subscribe to this plan.

Attributes.title: Base Plan Coupling
Attributes.description: Specify whether change flavor of base plan should change the add-on flavor.
Attributes.Definition: If the add-on is restricted to a specific base plan and "Base Plan Coupling" is enabled, the add-on flavor will be changed when the base plan flavor is changed during upgrade/downgrade. For example, a Device Silver add-on which is restricted to Silver base plan will be changed automatically to Device Gold add-on when the base plan is upgraded to Gold flavor.

Attributes.title: GL Code
Attributes.description: Specify Finance GL code for the rateplan.
Attributes.Definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

Attributes.title: Launch Date
Attributes.description: Specify launch date of the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the official launch of the plan for sale.

Attributes.title: Max Allowed Add-ons
Attributes.description: Specify number of this same add-on that a user can subscribe.
Attributes.Definition: Multiple add-ons of same type can be restricted to a specific number. If 0 is entered, then customer can get any number of this add-on.

Attributes.title: Notes
Attributes.description: Enter additional information here.
Attributes.Definition: Additional requirements on Add-on property can be added here.

Attributes.title: Package Code
Attributes.description: Specify CBCM Package Code for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

Attributes.title: Package Description
Attributes.description: Specify CBCM Package Description for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Every package has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.title: Permitted Base Plans
Attributes.description: Specify base plan flavors that are allowed by this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Base Plan flavors or all the Base Plan flavors within selected Services.

Attributes.title: Permitted Product Groups
Attributes.description: Specify product groups that are allowed by this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Product Groups.

Attributes.title: Permitted Services
Attributes.description: Specify services that are allowed by this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Services or all the services within selected Product Groups.

Attributes.title: Prohibited Add-ons
Attributes.description: Specify add-ons that are restricted to be provisioned with this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Some add-ons are not be allowed to be provisioned to satisfy the business case.

Attributes.title: Rateplan Code
Attributes.description: Specify CBCM Rateplan Code for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Rateplan Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

Attributes.title: Rateplan Description
Attributes.description: Specify CBCM Rateplan Description for the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Every rateplan has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.title: Required Add-ons
Attributes.description: Specify add-ons that are required by this add-on.
Attributes.Definition: These are pre-requisited whereby an add-on cannot be provisioned unless other add-on is provisioned first. Example of this is the discounted Device add-on that can be given only when there is a Data add-on.

Attributes.title: Required Role Name
Attributes.description: Specify required role names for the CRM user to grant access.
Attributes.Definition: Role name can be used to restrict the CRM users which are allowed to see and provision the base plan.

Attributes.title: System Closure Date
Attributes.description: Specify date when the rateplan was closed for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan deactivated in CBCM.

Attributes.title: System Offered Date
Attributes.description: Specify date when the rateplan was opened for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan activated in CBCM.

Attributes.title: Withdrawal Date
Attributes.description: Specify discontinuation date of the add-on.
Attributes.Definition: Date of stopping the plan for sale.

Attributes.title: Allow CUG
Attributes.description: Specify whether group call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Group usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.title: Allow Data
Attributes.description: Specify whether Data is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Data service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Data enabled. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no "Data Freebees" or "Data Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.title: Allow IBT
Attributes.description: Specify whether International Balance Transfer is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: A subscriber can transfer a credit to another user internationally. Balance transfer can happen via USSD code.

Attributes.title: Allow ICR
Attributes.description: Specify whether incoming call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Incoming roaming usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.title: Allow IDD
Attributes.description: Specify whether international call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: International usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.title: Allow LTE
Attributes.description: Specify whether 4G Data capability is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: 4G network is faster than 3G network.

Attributes.title: Allow MMS
Attributes.description: Specify whether MMS message is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Messaging service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Messaging service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no MMS "Message Freebees" or MMS "Message Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.title: Allow OGR
Attributes.description: Specify whether outgoing call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Outgoing roaming usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.title: Allow SMS
Attributes.description: Specify whether SMS message is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Messaging service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Messaging service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no SMS "Message Freebees" or SMS "Message Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.title: Allow STD
Attributes.description: Specify whether local call, message, and data are enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Local usages are mostly allowed.

Attributes.title: Allow UBT
Attributes.description: Specify whether User (National) Balance Transfer is enable or not.
Attributes.Definition: A subscriber can transfer a credit to another user locally. Balance transfer can happen via USSD code.

Attributes.title: Allow Video
Attributes.description: Specify whether video call is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Video service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Video service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no video "Call Freebees" or video "Call Usage" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.title: Allow Voice
Attributes.description: Specify whether voice call is enabled or not.
Attributes.Definition: Voice call service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Voice service enabled except for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no "Call Freebees" or "Call Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

Attributes.description: Specify segments allowed to subscribe to the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Certain customer categories or segments can be allowed to subscribe to this plan.

Attributes.title: Base Plan Name
Attributes.description: Specify name of the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Base plan name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service. Base plan name should include flavor name so it is distinctively identifiable.

Attributes.title: Eligible Special Number
Attributes.description: Specify format of the special number that are eligible by this base plan.
Attributes.Definition: A subscriber can be eligible for certain special number formats or categories as part of the base plan offer. --Example of special number format: 050-1234XXX. Example of special number categories: Silver Special Numbers or Diamond Special Numbers.

Attributes.title: GL Code
Attributes.description: Specify Finance GL code for the rateplan.
Attributes.Definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

Attributes.title: Launch Date
Attributes.description: Specify launch date of the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the official launch of the plan for sale.

Attributes.title: Max Allowed Plans
Attributes.description: Specify number of this same add-on that a user can subscribe.
Attributes.Definition: Multiple base plan of same type can be restricted to a specific number. If 0 is entered, then customer can get any number of this base plan.

Attributes.title: Package Description
Attributes.description: Specify CBCM Package Description for the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Every package has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.title: Payment Type
Attributes.description: Specify type of the base plan payment: Prepaid/Postpaid.
Attributes.Definition: A base plan can be Prepaid or Postpaid. Selecting this option has multiple consequences including but not limited to: Day of Monthly Charge, Day of Freebees Refill, Standard Call Usage Charge, and Invoice. Note that a Prepaid account can exist inside Postpaid forming a structure known as Hybrid account.

Attributes.title: Pre-activate Roaming
Attributes.description: Specify whether roaming service should be pre-activated automatically or not.
Attributes.Definition: Roaming service should be enabled in order to make roaming usages (Call, Message, or Data). Note there are also different caps for roaming usage which are configurable per customer if they meet the cap criteria.

Attributes.title: Primary Package Code
Attributes.description: Specify CBCM Primary Package Code.
Attributes.Definition: Primary Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a base service to a customer.

Attributes.title: Prohibited Add-ons
Attributes.description: Specify add-ons that are prohibited on this base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Some add-ons are not be allowed to be provisioned to satisfy the business case.

Attributes.Definition: Rateplan Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

Attributes.title: Rateplan Description

Attributes.Definition: Every rateplan has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

Attributes.title: Required Role Name
Attributes.description: Specify required role names for the CRM user to grant access.
Attributes.Definition: Role name can be used to restrict the CRM users which are allowed to see and provision the base plan.

Attributes.title: Service Class
Attributes.description: Specify class of the plan.
Attributes.Definition: Service class specifies the main category of the base plan.

Attributes.title: System Closure Date
Attributes.description: Specify date when the rateplan was closed for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan deactivated in CBCM.

Attributes.title: System Offered Date
Attributes.description: Specify date when the rateplan was opened for sale.
Attributes.Definition: Date of the rateplan activated in CBCM.

Attributes.title: Withdrawal Date
Attributes.description: Specify discontinuation date of the base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Date of stopping the plan for sale.

Attributes.title: Work Scope
Attributes.description: Specify whether to create a new base plan or modify an existing base plan.
Attributes.Definition: Modifying an existing base plan will affect all existing customers who are using it. Creating a new base plan will not impact existing customers.

Attributes.title: Eligible Number Category
Attributes.description: Specify eligible category of the special MSISDN number.
Attributes.Definition: Special MSISDN numbers of certain category can be given to the subscriber.

Attributes.title: Eligible Number Format
Attributes.description: Specify eligible format of the special MSISDN number.
Attributes.Definition: Special MSISDN numbers of certain format can be given to the subscriber. --For example, "050 1234 ???" will allow the customer to take numbers like 050 1234 825, 050 1234 343, and 050 1234 888.

Attributes.title: Extra SIM Charge
